page.title: 09Stock-rearing at Warkworth.
page.content: Southside Farm,Warkworth covers an area of 412 acres,divided into 21 fields.Most of the fields are left as pasture for the rearing of cattle and sheep. The farm was recently sold and the new oowner has temporarily rented some fields to neighbouring farmers as grass lets.Stock belonging to Southside include 374 breeding ewes,5 breeding cows,30 heifers,54 feeding bullocks and 17 store bullocks.The non-breeding stock will eventually be sold at nearby Acklington Mart or at Tyneside or Edinburgh Marts. In winter the animals'food is supplemented with turnips,hay and straw and crushed barley.These are grown on the farm.To increase production the land is fertilised with farmyard manure and chemical fertiser. The workforce consists of the farmer and his shepherd/stockman.
